# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    current_line_length = 0
    wrapped_text = ""

    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end

        if current_line_length != 0
            wrapped_text *= " "
            current_line_length += 1
        end

        wrapped_text *= word
        current_line_length += length(word)
    end

    return wrapped_text
end

print(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```

The function `wrap_string` splits the input text into words. It then iterates over each word and checks if adding the word to the current line would exceed the `text_width`. If it would, it starts a new line. Otherwise, it adds a space before the word and then adds the word to the current line. The function returns the wrapped text. The example usage prints the wrapped text of the input string "This function will wrap words into lines" with a default `text_width` of 10.
